title: anchorQueue.idx=0, next retry in...
body:
2022.99.99-dev-bcb3cac2 and other devel branch recent commits.

Enters endless loop once it starts hitting these links/anchorQueue messages, rewinding blocks using integration doesn't fix the issue, tried state_stages, state_headers, etc.

At first, I was experiencing this issue syncing polygon from archive backup at https://snapshots.matic.today/. Then, when rewinding failed, tried syncing from blank slate w/snapshots, same issue, but occurs much earlier in the block history, e.g.
INFO[08-26|14:14:53.381] { 1060514-1361695 links=301182 (1060514-1361695)} => 84c050e99f3d1476fe548370e7bff71ba29505dba559a6a08079266c349274ad, anchorQueue.idx=1, next retry in 4.999825896s
INFO[08-26|14:14:53.381] {31397105-31834289 links=437185 (31397105-31834289)} => f21cda8b4db9afc6af33ead02185b2612fd49bca487bd022a0ae5b261782f924, anchorQueue.idx=0, next retry in 4.406113172s

Have been trying to get polygon working for the past week or so, encountering at the above and similar errors.

Then, today, same issue happened while syncing eth mainnet, which had not ever been a problem until now.

I have the same issue when trying to sync polygon from snapshots. Looks like it was also reported in #4824 by @alexlee85 and it was concluded that it was an issue with Heimdall. I have checked my heimdall server and it appears to be healthy and it is visible to the erigon process, so I would appreciate any info about what was the specific issue with Heimdall. Also curious to know why this is now happening in an ethererum context?

For eth, I had to restore a backup from a week prior, there was no other way to recover.

I built a new erigon binary from alpha branch, rather than devel. I have fully caught up eth with it, and have not seen the issue resurface so far. It's possible it was a one-off error, and that devel would have been able to catch up as well, but I figured it was something to try.

Using alpha does not seem to make a difference for matic, however. I have not seen or noted any errors in the heimdall server, or the heimdall rest-server, both appear to be functioning as expected.

I restored matic from the initial state received from the snapshot site. Here is the log beginning stage six when the issue starts:

After looking through other current issues, the solution to this issue was found in #5112  by checking out commit 7dabdc3269f1e3b098fee5ab4d96ec843823a6fd from August 5th and building from there. Was able to fully catch up without issue.

That would mean that the problem commit happened sometime between August 5th and August 19th.

This issue persist even with the latest release `erigon version 2022.09.1-alpha-4067b7c4`
I had to revert to `erigon version 2022.99.99-dev-a02c71c0` (slightly after [v2022.08.01](https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/tree/v2022.08.01) with VRS fix) to get it to synchronize again because of #5112

After fully synchronizing on this older version, I then updated to the aforementioned latest release because the older version has a number of other issues (such as not being able to quit in execution stage). Since then I have not been able to make any progress on synchronization because of the same issue described here. Here are the logs, which are similar to the issue described above.
